title: If I were the President of Ghana - these are the issues and things that Im going to do
body_text:
Audio By Carbonatix
If I were the President of Ghana, then, I would have to act and behave like the former Prime Minister of Singapore, the late Lee Kwan Yew, and the current President of Rwanda, Paul Kagame, in Ghana our motherland. I would also be filled with the Spirit of God Almighty, which was in Joseph and Daniel so that I would be like them 100 per cent (Genesis 41 verses 37 to 50, Daniel 2 verses 19 to 23, 6 verses 1 to 3). I would be here to promote solely the welfare and the well-being of Children, Youth and Ordinary people (who are 90% of the population) as against that of Leaders, Elders and Elites (who are just 10% of the population).
Indeed, I shall strictly be LIKE Lee Kwan Yew/Paul Kagame President for the CORRUPT AND GLUTTONOUS: LEADERS, ELDERS AND ELITES OF GHANA WHO HAVE RULED THE COUNTRY FOR THE PAST THIRTY YEARS AND STILL WANT MORE. I shall also be FILLED with the Spirit of God Almighty and would be the SELFLESS AND BENEVOLENT LEADER LIKE Joseph/Daniel for the DISADVANTAGE AND VULNERABLE CHILDREN, YOUTH AND ORDINARY PEOPLE, and TAKE CARE OF THEM 100%.
Anyone who will put impediments as far as GROWTH, DEVELOPMENT, INDUSTRIALIZATION AND ADVANCEMENT of Ghana our Mother land shall be arrested, be detained and be jailed within one month (after going through the court procedures and process for one month), minimum of twenty years. Indeed, the fast-track court system is coming again.
Also, I would promote Productions, Infrastructure, Procreation and good family life (legal and spiritual marriage between a man and a woman, union between two families, husband and wife, like Adam and Eve- Genesis 2 verses 18, 21 to 25, 4 vs 1). I shall put a great halt to all the funds and money that some LEADERS, ELDERS AND ELITES give to SLAY QUEENS AND SIDE CHICKS ILLEGALLY.
Again, I would put an end to Corruption and Excessive Importation into the country. I would implement a serious Import Substitutions POLICIES to curtail imports, especially food). I would be a strictly benevolent dictator. A President is either being used by the Spirit of God or the spirit of Satan, his actions and inactions are either directed by God or Satan!
I am a child of God, His Spirit dwells in me, and have Jesus Christ the Son of God Almighty, as my Lord and personal Saviour, He lives in me. I am going to project four issues for Ghana: Jesus Christ, Productions of all kind, Infrastructure and Procreation (i.e. marriage, regular sex with husband and wife only-THE MALE SEX ORGAN PERMEATE THE FEMALE SEX ORGAN, having children minimum four and maximum ten. I would encourage all to seek God (through Jesus Christ), and see to the welfare and well-being of all so that all citizens would have Health and Wealth.
I believe that all the Presidents we have had to date have failed because the Spirit of the Lord God Almighty does not live in them. All the former Presidents have failed, because a spirit in Ghana bewitched all of them so that their good intentions could not be achieved. They eventually became corrupt and adulterous leaders. That evil spirit will be exorcized and be rebuked in the Name and the Blood of JESUS CHRIST the Son God Almighty, our Lord and Saviour. Currently, all those who want to become future Presidents in Ghana are brilliant and highly intelligent but that is not enough; they all lack wisdom and knowledge from God. Let them all come out and declare their stand either for or against- LGBTQIA+. INDEED, I AM AGAINST IT 100%.
A President is not supposed to be an English teacher or a lecturer speaking impeccable words and grammar. A President is not supposed to be a talking cricket engaging only in rhetorical and theoretical speeches with empty words lacking vision and mission. A President must think and behave like a Mathematician and a Scientist.
A President must Deal with physical and practical solutions for the ordinary people to see and feel good. A President must walk his talks. The solution to Ghana’s woes can only be solved through: SCIENCE, MATHEMATICS, TECHNOLOGY AND PRACTICAL ECONOMICS. It is not just talking economics.
Indeed, Mathematics may not teach us how to add happiness or how-to minus sadness. But, it does teach one very important thing; that is every problem has a solution. The solution to Ghana’s socio-economic development challenge is that we must all agree to cut what has been given to LEADERS, ELDERS AND ELITES (who constitute 10% of the population) continuously for the past thirty years, and then give them to CHILDREN, YOUTH AND ORDINARY PEOPLE (who are 90% of the population), from now on.
In 2016, presidential candidate of the New Patriotic Party (N.P.P.) - Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo said and I quote” We are sitting on money, but we are hungry”. It is very true. The truth is that we have a lot of money in Ghana, but is only meant for Leaders, Elders and Elites only and alone. There is nothing for Children, Youth and Ordinary People. If I were the President of Ghana, then, it would change. It would be stopped immediately. Children, youth and ordinary people would enjoy at the greater expense of our leaders, elders and elites. Amen.
NOTE THIS, if you are the President of Ghana and you fail or refuse to develop Northern Ghana, then, Ghana will never be developed and be well. I shall make the Northern Ghana to be like Malaysia, which will later catalyse the whole country to develop, first to be like Rwanda and later like Singapore. Amen.
IF I were the President of Ghana, Palm Nuts Plantation is going to be my number one money making production industry for the nation. Palm oil plantation will fetch us 10 billion Dollars or more annually, which is more than the revenues from Cocoa, Gold and Timber. We shall plant Palm nut trees all over the country, give more impetus to Benso Oil Palm Plantation (B.O.P.P.) and Twifo Oil Palm Plantation (T.O.P.P.) and create more of these factories all over the country like Juaben Oil Mills Ltd.
If I were the President of Ghana, then, I would not sit down doing nothing and laughing, while La Cote D’Voire is getting $8 Billion from Cocoa production annually and Ghana is getting a paltry amount of $ 2 Billion. I shall gather great men of wisdom, knowledge and thinkers with high scientific means, within two years (2023 to 2025). Invest more money unto the ground and pay the farmers and producers very well. And with that, we shall have $ 4 Billion from Cocoa production, after four years (2025 to 2027), we shall catch up with La Cote D’Voire with $ 8 Billion or more for Ghana our Mother land. Amen.
WHO IS THE PRESIDENT?
- HE IS THE PRODUCTION MANAGER OF ALL KIND IN THE COUNTRY.
- HE IS THE ONLY ONE, WHO IS IMBIBE WITH THE FULL POWER AND AUTHORITY OF THE COUNTRY, HE CAN PRAISE WHEN ONE DOES SOMETHING GOOD, AND PUNISHED AS WELL VERY SEVERE, WHEN ONE DOES SOMETHING WRONG.
- HE IS THE PROVIDER OF INFRASTRUCTURE (HE IS THE DEVELOPER) OF THE COUNTRY.
- HE MUST ENSURE THAT DEVELOPMENT RELATES TO GROWTH OF HUMAN CAPITAL INDEXES, A DECREASE IN INEQUALITY FIGURES, AND STRUCTURAL CHANGES THAT IMPROVE THE GENERAL POPULATION’S OF QUALITY LIFE.
- HE MUST ENSURE QUALITATIVELY-HDI (HUMAN DEVELOPMENT INDEX), GENDER RELATES INDEX(GDI) HUMAN POVERTY INDEX(HPI) REDUCE AND IMPROVE DRASTICALLY- INFANT MORTALITY REDUCE, MALNUTRITION, HUNGER, HOMELESSNESS, DISEASES, LITERACY RATE INCREASES ETC.
- HE MUST ENSURE THAT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IMPLIES CHANGES IN INCOME, SAVINGS, AND INVESTMENT ALONG WITH PROGRESSIVE CHANGES IN SOCIO-ECONOMIC STRUCTURE FOR ALL AND SUNDRY OF THE COUNTRY (INSTITUTIONAL AND TECHNOLOGICAL CHANGES).
- HE MUST ENSURE WE ACHIEVE THE WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION STANDARDS LEVEL OF HEALTH CARE- EXAMPLE NUMBER OF DOCTORS PER 1000 POPULATION.
- HE MUST ALSO ENSURE WE GET THE QUALITY, AVAILABLE AND AFFORDABLE OF HOUSING AND HIGH LEVEL OF ENVIRONMENTAL STANDARDS.
- HE MUST ENSURE THAT, THE INFORMAL SECTOR IF NOT ELIMINATED COMPLETELY, IS REDUCE DRASTICALLY. THE INFORMAL SECTOR ALSO KNOWN AS THE BLACK ECONOMY, WHICH IS UNRECORDED ECONOMIC ACTIVITY. INDEED, DEVELOPMENT ALLEVIATES PEOPLE FROM LOW STANDARDS OF LIVING INTO PROPER EMPLOYMENT WITH SUITABLE SHELTER.
- HE IS TO MAKE SURE WE STOP IMPORTING AT LEAST WHAT WE HAVE COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE OF AND INCREASE EXPORTS SIGNIFICANTLY. SO THAT, OUR DOMESTIC CURRENCY WILL BE STRONG, RESILIENCE AND STABLE AS AGAINST THE FOREING CURRENCIES. AND, AGAIN HE MUST ENSURE FOOD SUFFICIENCY, SUSTAINABILITY AND SECURITY ALL THE TIME FOR COUNTRY MEN AND WOMEN.
- HE MUST ALSO ENSURE THAT THE COUNTRY IS DEBT FREE. HE MUST NOT MAKE THE COUNTRY TO BE OVER BURDEN WITH TOO MUCH LOANS AND DEBTS.
- HE MUST ENSURE THAT CORRUPTION IS CURBED AT ONCE, BECAUSE CORRUPTION IS MURDER TO THE NATION. CORRUPTION IS INFRASTRUCTURE FORGONE.
The President, the Speaker of Parliament and the Chief Justice are in charge of the: Executive, Legislature and Judiciary respectively. But the three most important personalities of the Socio-Economic Development of the country are; the President, the Finance Minister and the Governor of Bank of Ghana. If they are competent, it will reflect in the welfare and well-being of children, youth and ordinary people. If they are not competent, it will also show badly, as we are experiencing in Ghana our Motherland now.
- President Paul Kagame of Rwanda said; “corruption is a murder to the nation”. From 1993 up until 2023, Ghana has been losing 3 billion Dollars every year. This implies that, from the era of President Rawlings, President Kuffour, President Prof. Mills, President Mahama and our current President Akuffo-Addo, Ghana has lost a total of about 90 billion Dollars over the past thirty years. All of these Presidents watched indifferently and unconcerned, while corruption thrived in our various systems and sectors. Misappropriation of funds, misapplication of funds, and mismanagement of funds have become the order of the day (MALFEASANCE AT THE HIGHEST LEVEL).
A report by Caroline Boateng of the Daily Graphic dated on July-04-2018, 07:56 indicate that, according to the deputy commissioner of the Commission on Human Rights and Administrative Justice (CHRAJ)- Rev. Richard Quayson, another story on corruption:
Ghana loses more than $3 billion yearly through corruption. Ghana loses us$3 billion to corruption a year
- Published: 19 August 2019
- Written by Zdravko ljubas
Despite being one of the least corrupt countries in Africa, Ghana is annually losing billions to graft - a menace that keeps people poor and shatters their dreams, officials said last week.
Ghana’sPresident Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo (photo: republic of Ghana, the presidency) Ghana’s anti-graft body, ghana integrity initiative (GII), which is transparency international’s local chapter, warned that the country “loses close to US$3 billion to corruption annually,” ghanaweb news portal reported on Wednesday.
The outlet cited G.I.I. executive director Madam Linda Ofori-Kwafo, who stressed that successive governments have attempted to minimise corruption through “moral crusades to uphold high ethics, the confiscation of properties found to have been acquired through corruption or public reforms,” but that there is still a long way ahead to fight the problem.
While most of the countries of the continent are awash with corruption, tiny Ghana is according to Transparency International (TI) corruption index among the least corrupt countries of the continent.
A recent corruption scandal serves as an example for acts that leave “citizens in poverty, joblessness, in their broken homes and with shattered dreams”.
Indeed, If I were the President of Ghana, then, I would have to built a corruption free and a discipline society. At the end of the day, we can get enough money to develop Ghana our motherland easily. Ecclesiastes 10 vs 19B- ‘but money answereth all things.’ the question is what do the White People do with money, and what do Black People like Ghana leaders do with money. For the White People, they will use the money to build infrastructure and production all over in their country. For we the black people, as it is typical in Ghana: they will steal some of the money and put them in their accounts abroad for safekeeping. And the rest of the money spend on slay queens and side chicks. ( Ecclesiastes 10:2)
Take the case of an investor wants to invest 500(five hundred) million Dollars in Ghana, and Mr. Charles Adu Boahen is demanding for 20% of this amount as a kick back, which is equivalent to 100 hundred million Dollars. Do you know what 100 million Dollars can do in the socio-economic development of the nation? It can be used to resolve the issue of schools under trees, procure text books, uniforms, Shoes, Canvas, Camp Boots, Sandals and Football Boots for all the school children in the country.
Barely 5 years ago, the cost of a Six-unit classrooms block was about GHS 250,000.00. Sadly, however, this same Six-unit classroom block cost a whopping amount of GHS 1,000,000.00. Thus, instead of GHS 1,000,000.00 giving us four Six-unit classrooms block, it can only afford one. This how bad corruption has devastated the country called Ghana. Indeed, corruption is infrastructure lost.
I SHALL first of all assemble all the Head Pastors in Ghana, so that we shall fast and pray to God Almighty for the sins of Ghana. It is believed that sometime ago, a pregnant woman was buried alive in Accra, and that sin committed by a Leader is still haunting us as a nation. (2 Chronicles 7 verses 13 to 14, 19 and 22, Proverbs 14 vs 34, Isaiah 59 vs 14, Jeremiah 7 verses 18 to 20, Ezekiel 37 verses 1 to 14). The sins of our leaders, elders and the elites, which have also affected children, youths and the ordinary people include are;
a. Idolatry/ the worship of other gods (Joshua 24 vs 2) and occultism.
b. Adultery in the name of protocol all over the country.
c. Committing murders indiscriminately (secret ones- honourable J.B. Danquah Adu and Ahmed Suale) all over the country.
d. Embezzlement of national funds.
e. Corruption, fraud and high white-collar crimes.
f. Telling lies all over the country (John 8 vs 44).
g. Peddling of Falsehood all over the country.
h. Fake Pastors/Prophets all over the Country
I. Fetish Priest/Priestess all over the place.
j. Fake Politicians all over the country.
k. Malfeasance deals from majority of professionals and technocrats.
l. Scammers all over the country.
m. llegal mining (galamsey) destroying lands and water bodies.
n. Filth, Garbage and Waste materials all over the nation.
o. White-Collar crime all over the nation.
p. Prostitutions of all kinds all over the nations.
q. Usage and Peddling of Drugs and blue-collar crimes
r. Unnecessary Borrowing and Misappropriation of funds.
- If I were the President, I am going to constitute a 24-hour prayer team for the nation. A prayer chain, consisting of both men and women, will pray in turns. As one team is ending another team will take over continuously. They will be paid by the state.
- All Pastors, Prophets and self-acclaimed Men and Women of God, must have at least a first Degree in Theology or Religious Studies, before they would be allowed to work in Ghana.
- All false, fake and fiendish Pastors, Prophets (charlatans) and fetish Priest and Priestess will not be allowed to operate in Ghana our mother. (Jeremiah 23 vs 11).
- From Monday to Friday, worship will be done between 4:30am in the morning to 7:30am and 6:00pm to 9:00pm in the evening. No church services will be held between 8am to 5pm, unless it is a special one for the nation. No all-night prayers within the weekdays, except Friday evening to Saturday morning. All must work period!
- Indeed, 10% praying, praising and worshipping God (personality of Jesus Christ) and also propagating the gospel, and then 90% productions, planning and working (principles of Jesus Christ) and also procreating very well to the glory of God (three (3) Ps: Prayer, Production and Procreation). These are what God is asking all men and women to do in order to experience progress and prosperity. If, it is the other way around, then, we shall experience retrogression and poverty, as it is being experienced in Ghana our mother land now. Indeed, 5% Spiritual and 95% Scientific approach to all issues.
- If I were the President of Ghana, then with immediate effect put a total ban on TV and Radio programmes concerning those who do doubling of money- SAKAWA- RITUAL BLOOD MONEY, SCAMMERS, ILLEGAL LOTTERY AND THE MY BET PROGRAMME NOT SUITABLE FOR THOSE UNDER EIGHTEEN YEARS ETC.
- I SHALL WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT, institutionalized development policies and all inclusive-unity government. I shall do what Prime Minister the late Lee Kwan Yew did in Singapore- MERITOCRACY, PRAGMATISM AND HONESTY (M.P.S.). I shall with immediate effect task the following five gentlemen: Prof. Joseph Magnus Frimpong, Prof. Cletus Kwashi Dordunoo, Prof. Peter Quartey, Prof. Godfred Alufar Bokpin and Prof. John Gartchie Gatsi to come out with economic wisdom, knowledge, ideas and scientific solutions within one month to help me solve the ailing GHANAIAN ECONOMY. Why do we have five astute Professors of Economic and Finance or even more in Ghana and our economy is in great distress and tatters and the President is not consulting them.
- I shall organise the market women, tune their mind that, very soon all of them will working at the factories, and also regulate the informal sector very, get them all registered and be control and get the understanding of taxation, so that they will pay tax very well.
- If I were the President of Ghana, then within six months (from June to December 2023), I shall ensure food prices come down significantly. If a ball of Kenkey cost GHS 5.00, GHS 4.00, GHS 3.00 and GHS 2.00, shall come to Ghana pesewas 0.50, 0.40, 0.30 and 0.20 respectively. A bag of Rice which on an average is selling at GHS 500.00 shall come to GHS 50.00. A bag of Maize which is selling at GHS 800.00 shall come to GHS 80.00, if cocking Oil on an average barrel cost GHS 400.00, shall be bought for GHS 400.00. A tuber of Yam selling at GHS 20.00 shall come to GHS 2.00 and bunch of Plantain selling at GHS 50.00 shall come to GHS 5.00. if a bowl or plate of food cost GHS 100.00, it shall come to GHS 10.00 and also GHS 50.00, it shall come to GHS 5.00 and on and on. Indeed, this is not a PROMISE but a PROPHESY (2 KINGS 7: 1 TO 18). If you don’t believe in these, then you will not live to see the glory of God coming to Ghana very soon. Amen.
- I SHALL immediately move the capital town from Accra to the middle of Ghana: between Kintampo and Yeji, a town call Nyamoase or Nyamease, within one and half years (May 2023 to December 2024), from getting to the high office (some examples; Nigeria- from Lagos to Abuja, La Cote D’Voire- from Abidjan to Yamoussoukro, Tanzania- from Dodoma to Dar Es Salaam and Brazil- Rio de Janeiro to Brasilia). I shall invest one billion Dollars into the National Health Insurance Scheme (N.H.I.S.). Indeed, I shall take very good care of children, youth, ordinary people, the aged, poor and the needy. Amen.
- From Wenchi-Nsawkaw-Bole-Bamboi-Wa-Lawra-Jirapa to Hamile, Kintampo-Babato Kuma- Buipe- Yapei- Tamale-Walewale-Bolgatanga-Navrongo to Paga, and then Dambai/Kpassa- Bimbilla- Yendi-Saboba- Chereponi- Nakpanduri to Bawku. And also, from Atebubu-Yeji- Nyamease- Mankango- Salaga to Tamale. From these areas of upper Central and Northern Ghana, I am going to implement within one year (May 2023 to June 2024): Infrastructure, Farms and Factories (I.F.F.). I shall invest two billion Dollars for these areas’ development (S.A.D.A. and One Village One Dam). Within four years (2023 to 2027), Northern Ghana is going to change significantly by way of infrastructure: roads, housing and apartments, schools, hospitals, electricity, water etc.
- We are going to build hostels in every district in these northern areas, - from six to twelve storey structures, and even taller structures than these. I shall bring all the youths all over the country, all the head potters (Kayayo ladies) and the unemployed adult to these places. Free apartments for all of them. They will be fed morning, afternoon and evening, and they would receive monthly allowances of GHS 2,000.00 as well. There will be evening classes from 6:00 pm to 9:00 pm for those who would want to continue and further their educational levels.
- If I were the President, then, every household in Ghana within one year is going to have: toilets, bathrooms and kitchen. And very good waste and garbage attending system-from 2023 to 2024. Washrooms, urinals provided all over the villages, towns, cities and our highways. Street lights within our towns and cities and our highways all over the country within a year (a typical example in Takoradi- from Apollo Junction to Nkroful junction, the dual lane). I shall also increase the livelihood empowerment against poverty (L.E.A.P.) allowances from GHS 191.00 to GHS 500.00 every month. I shall also increase the funds for the orphanages and take very good of the orphans.
- If I were the President of Ghana, then, I shall with immediate with pay rural deprivation allowance of GHS 200.00 to all our folks in the rural areas every month, from 1957 up to now 2023, the leadership have left the rural areas unattended to, making them impoverish, primitive and ignorant. This is very bad and evil, I shall take very good care of our brothers and sisters from the Rural areas, upon presenting your Ghana Card, you will be paid. I shall also immediately paid WIDOW MITE”S allowance of GHS 200.00 to our old ladies all over the country, especially to our old ladies at Gambaga( Old ladies camp).
- If I were the President, then I would invest one billion Dollars into food and agriculture. Indeed, from Accra to Paga, Tema to Bawku, and Axim to Hamile, from the South, East, West, Central, Middle and Northern parts of Ghana is full of arable lands (Psalms 67vs 6). It is a BIG shame that, all the former Presidents and the current President have to look unconcern, while we import food OF all kind and types from A-Z into our beloved country.
- Within one year of my leadership and with Godly and Christ-like stewardship, we shall stop importing food into the country (2023 TO 2024). I SHALL bring back Operation Feed Yourself, back yard farming, I will use some of the ideas from the late Mr. Dan Lartey (we shall eat what we grow and canned what cannot eat), those who do five acres of farming or more will be given allowance GHS 500.00, every month. And also, free fertilizers, periodically their farms will be spray against insecticides and weedicides to ensure food: SUFFIENCY, SUSTAINABILITY AND SECURITY (Genesis 41vrs 48 to 49). I am going to reduce POST-HARVEST LOSS DRASTICALLY, we shall introduce trucks and vans going around the country to each and every farm gate to collect food stuffs, vegetables and fruits. These would be store at the various silos and warehouse for storage and processing.
- If I were the President of Ghana our Motherland, then All schools under trees would be eradicated within six months (June 2023 to December 2023). All classrooms are going to get full furniture, schools- library, science laboratories with computers for all the children, textbooks, uniforms, Slippers, Shoes, Sandals and Canvas or Camp Boots, House attires, Church attires and football boots be supplied to all pupils from kindergartens, Basic primaries to J.H.S. It will later be extended to the S.H.S. Level. We shall give to those whose parents are below the Middle-income belts to the lowest in the level of society.
- Pupils and students are going to be fed twice every day: morning and afternoon for the day students, and the boarding students the usual evening meals with snacks (fruit juice) and desserts. And this will lead to MECHANIZE AGRICULTURE AND SCIENTIFIC LEARNING AT THE HIGHEST LEVEL. And also, brand new school bus would be purchase for all pupils from primary to S.H.S. Buses for the public schools will given to them free and the private schools as soft loan.

Programmes very, in all the various secondary schools, I am going to attach the T.V.E.T. programmes to all the S.H.S. in Ghana. Those who will opt for the T.V.E.T. programme is going to be totally free and a monthly allowance of GHS 2,000.00 be given to each student as well.
- I shall establish Technical Universities at Damongo, Nalerigu, Dambai, Techiman, Goaso and Sefwi Wiowso to compliment all the regional capitals. At the end of the day, I will want to bridge the gap between the over producing academic students with more artisans with high dexterity. Less oral and theoretical education (recalling and memorising education) to more of physical and practical education with science and technology (recognising and creating education) how to make, create and produce all our needs and wants, for that matter gradually stop importing. All children from the age six up to seventeen will be taught how to ride bicycle free of charge, and then own one later.

If by accident our female teenage girls get pregnant, none of them should perform abortion or no one should advice or induce them to abort the foetus.
- Indeed, abortion is abolished in Ghana unless the lady involve life is at risk, the state will take care of them 100%, after that, their babies will be look after, for them to continue their education, be it academic or artisan one. Upon completion, they will get job at the factories to work. And then will be assist to get married and have a good life. - Ladies who want to marry between the ages 20 to 24, will be supported by the state, and also, gentlemen who want to marry between the ages 26 to 29, the same for them (GHS 3,000.00) will be given to each will be couples. Free accommodation for all of them, transport allowances, utilities will be paid for them. I will encourage ladies to marry immediately after attaining 1st Degree and give birth to about two or three, then, they will be sponsor to do 2nd Degree and any other advance courses.
- Children from age zero to seventeen will enjoy free health care till they attain 18 years, senior citizens from ages sixty-one and above will also enjoy free health to the highest-level till they died, those were below middle-income earners would be given GHS 1,000.00 in addition to their pension pay. All children from age two to seventeen years will be given one egg, a BIG cup of hot milo with milk and big bread with chocolate spread or margarine. Indeed, total elimination of KWASHIORKOR CHILDREN from Ghana.
- They shall also take one canned Malt or fruit juice, every afternoon, after taken their meals- Rice, Wheat, Millet, Sorghum, Yam, Plantain, Banku with proper Corn Dough with small Cassava Dough, with Fish, Chicken, Beef, Goat meat, with Kontomire stew, Palm nut soups and Beans, Groundnut soups etc, intersperse with Prekese or Dawadawa, which also a free meal. Proper balanced diet with more protein, carbohydrate, good fats, vitamins and minerals. Children and the youth must be given more vegetables and fruits of all kind always for their good HEALTHY upbringing. Women, who give birth to more children, that is six children and more will be given monthly allowances of GHS 2,000.00, their children will be taken care of by the state, with full scholarships. Every pregnant woman who are below middle-income belt, shall be given monthly allowance of GHS 300.00 and free medical throughout the pregnancy duration, especially those below the middle-income brackets.
- If I were the President, then within one year (June 2023 to June 2024), I shall ban the importation of Rice, Chicken and all kind of meats and fish products into the country. I SHALL immediately bring Mr. Abraham Dwuma Odoom, the engineered who pioneered the Nigerian’s rice production success story. Give him 100% blessings to do same in Ghana our mother land. The Aveyime, Nasia and other small rice production farmers will be given very soft loans to boost and improve the rice production significantly.
- Indeed, from 1993 up to now 2023, Rice Masters and other Rice importers have been financing and supporting all the previous Presidents and the current President. Majority of those who want to become President 2025, have been given money from the importers. In 2017, this current government said, we shall stop importing Rice by 2023. Now they have shifted the goal post to 2026 said by Dr. Owusu Afriyie Akoto, former Agric Minister.
- Rice importation alone cost us 900 hundred million Dollars a year, and Chicken also cost 400 hundred million Dollars within the same period of one year. When, you sum up the two, they are costing us 1.3 billion Dollars, which is almost half of the 3 billion Dollars, the NPP government is begging from the International Monetary Fund (I.M.F.) and for that matter doing that ungodly and unnecessary Domestic Debt Exchange Programme (D.D.E.P.). After, one year all what we eat and drink will also be banned from coming into the country (June 2023 to June 2024).
- If I were the President of Ghana, then, from May 2023 to May 2024, I shall work very hard to stop importation of Mobile phones into the country. Indeed, mobile phone users in Ghana as at 2022 hit 45 million mobile connections, up from 41.69 million, published by Doris Dokua Sasu.
